creator: pierrick.brihaye@free.fr
text:
Hi,

In org.apache.batik.svggen.font.SVGFont, we have :

SVG_ARABIC_FORM_ATTRIBUTE + XML_EQUAL_QUOT + SVG_INITIAL_VALUE + XML_CHAR_QUOT,
SVG_ARABIC_FORM_ATTRIBUTE + XML_EQUAL_QUOT + SVG_MEDIAL_VALUE + XML_CHAR_QUOT,
SVG_ARABIC_FORM_ATTRIBUTE + XML_EQUAL_QUOT + SVG_TERMINAL_VALUE + XML_CHAR_QUOT,
SVG_ARABIC_FORM_ATTRIBUTE + XML_EQUAL_QUOT + SVG_ISOLATED_VALUE + XML_CHAR_QUOT,

It results that a font with arabic glyphes generates a wrong XML file because
there is not space after the preceding attribute value.

each line should be introduced by : XML_SPACE +

BTW, what is the JVM target for Batik ? Generating XML with a PrintStream may
cause some XML issues. A JDK 1.4+ SAX (identity) transformation would be more
robust and easier to maintain IMHO.

Cheers,

p.b.
